title: 110_hr3313
content: The Act is titled the "Improving Mathematics and Science Teacher Quality Act." It amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to focus on partnerships for Mathematics and Science Teacher Quality Improvement. The "Improving Mathematics and Science Teacher Quality Act" amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include businesses and informal science education centers in professional development programs. It aims to replicate and apply effective model programs on a broader scale. The "Improving Mathematics and Science Teacher Quality Act" expands professional development programs to include businesses and informal science education centers. Amendments include adding a teacher training department of an institution of higher education and a consortium of businesses to the definition of eligible organizations. The "Improving Mathematics and Science Teacher Quality Act" now includes an informal science education center in the definition of eligible organizations for professional development programs. It also clarifies the terms "mathematics and science teacher" and "science" to encompass technology and pre-engineering in elementary and secondary education. SEC. 3. GRANTS FOR PARTNERSHIPS FOR MATHEMATICS AND SCIENCE TEACHER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. The section heading for section 2202 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to read as "GRANTS FOR PARTNERSHIPS FOR MATHEMATICS AND SCIENCE TEACHER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT." The section heading for section 2202 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to read as "GRANTS FOR PARTNERSHIPS FOR MATHEMATICS AND SCIENCE TEACHER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT." Subsection (a) is amended to redesignate paragraphs and authorize grants to State educational agencies for eligible partnerships to carry out authorized activities. Subsection (b) is amended regarding application requirements. The application requirements for eligible partnerships seeking subgrants under this part include submitting an application to the State educational agency with specified information and activities based on research or approved programs. The application requirements for eligible partnerships seeking subgrants under this part include submitting an application to the State educational agency with specified information and activities based on research or approved programs. In awarding grants, priority is given to partnerships that prioritize student academic achievement and improve the quality of mathematics and science instruction. Amendments are made to subsections to reflect these priorities. The educational agency prioritizes partnerships replicating model math and science programs. Amendments are made to subsections to include activities for professional development programs. The Secretary shall consult and coordinate with the National Science Foundation for activities to improve math and science teaching in schools. Collaboration with the Foundation is essential for making resources widely available. The Secretary will collaborate with the National Science Foundation to disseminate information on model programs and hold an annual summit with partnership grantees to review progress and results of awarded grants. In paragraph (1), replace "an evaluation" with "a scientifically valid and rigorous evaluation". One-half of one percent of funding will be reserved for training and technical assistance for eligible partnerships to conduct evaluations. Subsection (g) is amended to require the Secretary to place the report on the Department's website. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Grants to States, Local Educational Agencies, and Eligible Partnerships under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 are amended. SEC. 2103 authorizes appropriations for grants to States, Local Educational Agencies, and Eligible Partnerships for fiscal year 2008 and the following 5 years. The Secretary must reserve 15-20% of funds for part B. National Programs amendment changes the year from 2002 to 2008, and a conforming amendment repeals Section 2203 of the Act.
